text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion specifically asks for the identification of the relevant Moral Right to the alteration of character as the Right of Integrity (s.80 CDPA 1988). The candidate answer mentions Moral Rights, specifically the 'right to be identified as the author' (which is the Right of Paternity, s.77 CDPA 1988), but it completely fails to mention or identify the Right of Integrity (s.80 CDPA 1988) in relation to the alteration of the character 'Ophelia' used in the advertisement.", "criterion_id": "07e967a4-3303-4bab-a56d-961b4b8ee3fd"}
